result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D. Slocum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Participate in and successfully complete Marathon County Drug Treatment Court Program with post drug court programming.  Attend and present to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months; these three occasions would be at 1, 3 and 6 month mark or additional times at agent's discretion. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent/Drug Court Team. 

AODA and follow through. 

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.
Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol or controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations at Drug Court Team discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D. Slocum

records.addlTxt: Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding Enhancer Statute subdivision
$5,000 cash bond (not signed and not posted) -- deft in treatment

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  2:31 p.m. 
INCLUDES 20CF1268, 21CF553, 21CF1473, 22CF864, 22CF878.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski for ADA Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Atty Anne Katte by video. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing. 
ADA Zibolski advises waiver of prelim needs to be held in 22CF864 and 22CF878 before proceeding with plea. 
Atty Katte is in agreement and advises deft is willing to waive preliminary hearing. 
COURT questions deft as to waiver in 22CF864 and 22CF878.  
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 

PLEA/SENTENCING>>
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

20CF1268>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/PTAC/Repeater)>>Court grants.  
Count 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater)>>Court grants. 

21CF553>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)>>Court grants. 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 

21CF1473>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants.  
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 
Count 5 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/PTAC/Repeater)>>Court grants. 

22CF864>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 

22CF878>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>Court grants. 
Count 5 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>Court grants.  

PLEA: 

20CF1268>>
Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC/Repeater):  NO CONTEST.  
Count 3 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance 3rd/Repeater): NO CONTEST.  

22CF864>>
Count 1 (Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent/Repeater/PTAC): NO CONTEST.  
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.  

22CF878>>
Count 1 (Possess w/Intent -Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc. >3-10g/Repeater/Second and Subsequent Offense):  NO CONTEST.  
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS>>

20CF1268 Count 1:  SWH for 3 years probation; concurrent with each other.  CONDITIONS:  Participate in and successfully complete Marathon County Drug Treatment Court Program with post drug court programming; Attend and present to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months; these three occasions would be at 1, 3, 6 month mark or additional times at agent's discretion.  6 months MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations at Drug Court Team discretion.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent/Drug Court Team.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.   AODA and follow through.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  

20CF1268 Count 3:  SWH for 2 years probation; concurrent with each other.   Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 24 months.  24 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA.  CONDITIONS:  45 days jail; concurrent to any other sentence.  Participate in and successfully complete Marathon County Drug Treatment Court Program with post drug court programming; Attend and present to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months; these three occasions would be at 1, 3, 6 month mark or additional times at agent's discretion.  6 months MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations at Drug Court Team discretion.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent/Drug Court Team.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.   AODA and follow through.  $1744.00 fine inclusive of costs.  DNA sample/surcharge.  

22CF864 Count 1 and 2:  SWH for 3 years probation; concurrent with each other.  CONDITIONS:  Participate in and successfully complete Marathon County Drug Treatment Court Program with post drug court programming; Attend and present to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months; these three occasions would be at 1, 3, 6 month mark or additional times at agent's discretion.  6 months MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations at Drug Court Team discretion.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent/Drug Court Team.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.   AODA and follow through.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Restitution in the amount of $1,683.00 including 10% surcharge; Joint and Several with co-defts, Crystal Taylor and Porscha Young. 

22CF878 Count 1: SWH for 7 years probation; concurrent with each other.  CONDITIONS:  Participate in and successfully complete Marathon County Drug Treatment Court Program with post drug court programming; Attend and present to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months; these three occasions would be at 1, 3, 6 month mark or additional times at agent's discretion.  6 months MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations at Drug Court Team discretion.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent/Drug Court Team.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.   AODA and follow through.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  

22CF878 Count 2:  SWH for 3 years probation; concurrent with each other.  CONDITIONS:  Participate in and successfully complete Marathon County Drug Treatment Court Program with post drug court programming; Attend and present to drug court on at least 3 separate occasions within 6 months; these three occasions would be at 1, 3, 6 month mark or additional times at agent's discretion.  6 months MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations at Drug Court Team discretion.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent/Drug Court Team.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.   AODA and follow through.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  

COURT grants the following sentence credit: 
20CF1268>>3 days.
22CF864>>68 days. 
22CF878>>69 days. 
21CF553>>6 days. 
21CF1473>>28 days.  

Adj:  3:08 p.m.
